Articles.Content:
This is the official dev thread of my Tantares mini-expansions!

Alot of things have yet to be finished, and the future is very bright, but this is where the things happen.

**BIG SOYUZ DEV**

![nFXrZi6.png](http://i.imgur.com/nFXrZi6.png)

![GrbTfKh.png](http://i.imgur.com/GrbTfKh.png)

Big Soyuz "Big Khleb" is a late tech tree wonder that has many uses. It's crew size is 6 kerbals, and has enough fuel in the descent module to land on the Mun or any other celestial bodies with enough to get back home in one piece. Whatever the mission is for this spacecraft, the sky's the limit!

An IVA is planned with full RPM and ASET integration.

--

**CEV RAYTHEON DEV**

![53jJtSC.png](http://i.imgur.com/53jJtSC.png)

(HEAVY WIP)

CEV RAYTHEON "Scobee" is a 1.875m crew vehicle that can be used to ferry tourists to your LKO station and back, or if you need a low-cost orbital vehicle, and you want to take a pilot, scientist and engineer up to the Mun, but you haven't unlocked the MK 1-2 Command Module yet. Scobee's crew size is 3 kerbals.

An IVA is planned with full RPM and ASET integration.

--

**Edited <time datetime="2015-08-14T01:31:35Z" title="08/14/2015 01:31  AM" data-short="8 yr">August 14, 2015</time> by Sylandro**

Nice! Looking forward to this.

Please don't abandon this after very little work like your other mod attempts, though.

And it's Big Khleb, please.

> 
> Nice! Looking forward to this.
> Please don't abandon this after very little work like your other mod attempts, though.
> 
> And it's Big Khleb, please.

I promise i won't! I will need some help, though.

Anyway, i'm going to remodel the CEV Raytheon/Scobee.

- - - Updated - - -

Double Post:

And she's done!

![TogfZzF.png](http://i.imgur.com/TogfZzF.png)

The flat spots on the service module will be integrated RCS ports.

> 
> Have you abandoned this?
> ![-_-](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_sleep.png)

No, no i haven't. It's on hold until i can find a good texture artist.

On the other side, i am working on the Apollo. And the Lunar Module, too!

> 
> No, no i haven't. It's on hold until i can find a good texture artist

 Tantares+ uses Tantares textures, you could probably do the same thing.
